page.title: 01North Morven and Deskryside
page.content: _This isolated and uninhabited hill area is dominated by the E/W ridge of Morven Hill which forms the southern boundary of the block. The basic igneous rock that underleis the central and soutehrn portions of the block results in a more grassy heathland than is normal in this heather dominated region. The NW corner of the block is occupied by the headwaters of the Deskry Water, the course of which is followed by a land rover track. North of this burn, the eastern part is afforested with a dense plantation of conifers. The only human activity apart from forest management is a seasonal grazing of sheep and shooting of grouse.
